Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2015 08:29PM Allyme wrote: Hey Everyone! Lost count of what number I'm supposed to be, but I have been around here for about 7 months. I was dx stage 4 bc at the ER, when I had went for abdominal pain. I was originally told I was just constipated, and how badly I wish that was true! I have Mets to my liver and spine. Currently just on Herceptin and Perjeta, and trying to make everyday count with my husband of 17yrs and my loving 15 year old daughter. I'm so thankful for the advice, information, and friendships I have made here. It makes it a little easier to know I'm not alone in this nightmare. Thankful for the sense of community and, at times, humor. Wishing the best for us all, and this wacky keyboard!! :)

Posts.Title: Hospice for me Annie62 RonnieKay

Posts.Content: Allyme wrote: I was dx 7 months ago with stage 4 breast cancer. The problem is, I was dx at another hospital a week earlier with constipation, because of pain meds. I NEVER had any symptoms of breast cancer at all. I don't believe I really have breast cancer. I've been doing all their tx, but I feel so much worse than before I was dx. I'm beginning to wonder if that hospital is wrong. I am wondering what would have happened if I was never dx with cancer. Since I had no symptoms, what would have happened to me at the age of 36. Did anybody else have no symptoms before being dx as stage 4 breast cancer? I just think I felt much better before tx, and wonder if I should just stop. I've always had weak bones, but that was always blamed on me smoking and the Depo shot. Osteopenia started in my mid-twenties. Maybe I'm just optimistic, but I don't understand how someone can have no symptoms, even if they are dx with stage 4 cancer. If someone could respond to this mystery, I'd really appreciate it . Thanks bunches. :) Targeted Therapy 9/27/2014 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Targeted Therapy 9/27/2014 Perjeta (pertuzumab) Dx 9/28/2014, Stage IV, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Chemotherapy 9/30/2014 Taxol (paclitaxel) Radiation Therapy 10/31/2014 Bone Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Totally Confused! Allyme LindaE54

Posts.Content: May 12, 2015 08:59PM Allyme wrote: Thanks for responding Blue mnm, I was having my usual constipation pain. The CT scan, x-rays, and other scans all showed constipation. Next week, the other hospital did the same scans and says stage 4 breast cancer. I only went to the other hospital because I was embarrassed about still being constipated. I just don't understand any of this. Especially when I read that It's not uncommon for breast cancer to be misdiagnosed. I've read that 44% of the time, the lady has no cancer at all.
Posts.Title: Totally Confused! Allyme LindaE54

Posts.Content: May 12, 2015 09:49PM Allyme wrote: LindaE54, No. I've never gotten anything, but their insurance billing codes. I just don't feel comfortable continuing with tx that I'm not sure I need. Plus, I think I might do better without it. Before, I felt fine. Now, I can barely get out of bed in the morning. It hurts my legs and ankles so bad. Before this tx, I was completely fine. That's why I don't know if I should even continue with the tx. I do know that if I find out, the amount of lifetime is the same, I am definitely stopping tx.
Posts.Title: Totally Confused! Allyme LindaE54

Posts.Content: May 14, 2015 12:35AM Allyme wrote: Hey Divine, I read it on an ABC news online called "Misdiagnosed Cancer Not Uncommon". I have many reasons not to trust doctors, but the stories are way to long to write, especially with the keyboard typing on here. One is when I was in Iraq, dx with a hip sprain. I hurt so badly, but continued with my job for almost 3 months. They only sent me to be tested at Baghdad because they didn't believe me. Turned out I had a femoral neck fracture in my hip. A few more steps and I would have needed a total hip replacement. Instead, I ended up having to have emergency screws put in my hip to hold it together, just so I could make it to Germany. The command actually had the nerve to call, the same one who didn't believe me. The hospital personnel tried to give me the phone and I refused it. He said " what should I say? " I said tell him I'm asleep or dead. I never talked to him and he never complained about it. That's one reason I lack trust. Anyway, Thanks for responding and for hearing my insight. :)
Posts.Title: Totally Confused! Allyme LindaE54

They did a biopsy of a liver tumor and said it appeared to be salivary or breast cancer, and decided to go with breast cancer because it's "more common".I just pray that God will show them the right dx.

Posts.Title: Totally Confused! Allyme LindaE54

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2015 10:18PM Allyme wrote: Stress could be a cause of my bc. I have no family history of cancer of any kind in my family. My genetic testing was negative. I ate healthy and exercised regularly. I did have a child, who I did breast feed. I thought I was doing everything right to avoid this type of diagnosis. But my job has always been in the medical field, and I deployed to Iraq as a medic. I was dx with stage 4 bc within 4 years of returning from my deployment to iraq. Do I think that deployment may have had a hand in my dx? Perhaps, it was a very stressful time for me. Others have also been dx with cancers after coming back from deployments. It may be coincidence, but we can't know for sure. Would i still have bc if I hadn't deployed to Iraq? I'll never know. I'm not even sure I'd like to know the answer to that at this time or not. Hope this helps some. :)
Posts.Title: Did having a stressfull life cause your breast cancer? new2bc Bren-2007

Posts.Content: May 14, 2015 12:07AM Allyme wrote: thsizit7, I'm so glad you responded. You made me feel somewhat better about this situation. I totally agree with you. I just get so discouraged, and I'm desperate not to leave my family. I don't think my 15 year old daughter could handle this, I know I couldn't. I also don't think my mom could handle this, because she just lost her own mom and dad. I just pray everyday that God will help us all by letting a cure be found. Thanks so very much for your insight and advice. I appreciate you! :)

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2015 09:50PM - edited Mar 15, 2015 09:51PM by Allyme I just got diagnosed with stage 4 breast cancer with Mets to my bones and liver, back in September 2014. Forgive my ignorance, but what is NED? Also, does stage 4 mean we are on chemo forever, do we ever get to have hair again? I'm not familiar with all this yet, as my onc moved and had to start over with a new one. So far, I've had 8 rounds of radiation and next week will be my 5th chemo of herceptin and Perjeta, along with taxol. I used to have liver pain and vomiting. Now the pain isn't as often and haven't had vomiting in while. Just had a PET that showed no progression, but still have to go over the results with my onc to ask more about the liver. Is it better to just have the tumor removed? Thanks for any info! :)

Posts.Title: How do you not think about having cancer daily? Allyme Shutterbug73

Posts.Content: Allyme wrote: I'm 37, stage 4 breast cancer with Mets to my bones and liver. I've been doing my treatments, which have been going fine. Just had my 5th round of Chemo, h&p along with taxol. My treatment plan was radiation: completed 8 before i ended up in the hospital. And chemo: last taxol will be next month! I can't wait to have hair again! I'm still going to be on h&p for maintenance. My PET shows no progression and some of the tumors have seemed to disappear. I'm very happy with the results! I just don't know what to tell my parents. They are really big on prayer and the church, being from a small town in TN. Everytime I talk to them about my cancer, they say that they feel God Has already healed me. They don't seem to want me to continue with treatment, because they feel I've already been healed, even though I tell them my results. I get frustrated because I don't think they understand, and I don't know how to get them to understand. It just seems they are disappointed with me for not relying on spiritual healing instead. I believe in spiritual healing, but I can't see relying on that alone. Anybody with any suggestions/info would be greatly appreciated! Thanks! :) Targeted Therapy 9/27/2014 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Targeted Therapy 9/27/2014 Perjeta (pertuzumab) Dx 9/28/2014, Stage IV, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Chemotherapy 9/30/2014 Taxol (paclitaxel) Radiation Therapy 10/31/2014 Bone Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: anyone have problems with fecal incontinence? Allyme tinyturtle

Posts.Content: May 5, 2015 06:15PM Allyme wrote: Thanks bunches for responding, everybody. I really appreciate the info and advice. The MO ' S nurse is rude and acts like everything she has to do is bothersome to her. I actually had to go in person on Monday to ask about my labs, since the MO or his nurse wouldn't call us back after at least 4 messages my DH AND I Left for them. The results are available online, so we knew they were back. We only wanted someone to go over them with us. I had my appointment with the MO on Wednesday, Who Said he'd call on Friday to go over the results. He never did. So Monday, his nurse said he'd call us in 20 minutes to go over them. After 2 hours, that's when we finally went in person to ask. Anyway, I have an appointment with a new MO in 2 weeks. I plan on asking about all of my options, even stopping all treatment. I love my DH and daughter very much, but it's so hard to find help. Thanks for responding. :)
Posts.Title: anyone have problems with fecal incontinence? Allyme tinyturtle

Posts.Content: Allyme wrote: This is an embarrassing problem I have been having for about a week now. I am no longer on taxol. The last taxol was 18 March. I am just on Herceptin for now, the Perjeta was put "on hold" after my allergic reaction that I had after 6 months of use. Anyway, I'm only 37 and have never had fecal leakage before. It's embarrassing and scary to me. It didn't start until I had started taking Metamucil, as a preventive measure from all the painkillers I'm prescribed. I wasn't having any constipation problems, but was just trying to prevent any. I don't know if this is what caused the new problem or not. Any ideas would be greatly appreciated. I haven't been on here lately, because I have just been so depressed. :( Thanks for any responses. Posts.Title: anyone have problems with fecal incontinence? Allyme tinyturtle

Posts.Content: May 3, 2015 03:19AM Allyme wrote: Thank you all for responding. I feel so much better. I have been trying the Imodium and it seems to be working some. I had been eating mostly cream of wheat before all this happened because I was trying to avoid constipation. Then I got the Metamucil too. I was so stupid to mess with something that wasn't broken in the first place. I was having regular bowel movements, I was just scared of constipation. It's not liquid leakage, it's just soft and unformed leakage. I was just so upset, crying, and depressed thinking my life was just over. Thanks for responding and giving other possibilities. I appreciate you all so much. :)
Posts.Title: anyone have problems with fecal incontinence? Allyme tinyturtle

Posts.Content: May 2, 2015 06:07PM Allyme wrote: Thanks for responding, Winning. I stopped taking the Metamucil about 4 or 5 days ago. That's why I don't know why I'm having leakage. I'm trying to give it some time to see if it'll stop on it's own. I'm so nervous and depressed, thinking it's another Met. I do appreciate your response very much though. :)
Posts.Title: anyone have problems with fecal incontinence? Allyme tinyturtle

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2015 09:01PM Allyme wrote: Soldieron, I think that's an appropriate way to explain it to a five year old, without causing any over-reactions of being scared or anxiety. I have no idea what i would have said. My daughter is 15 years old, so there was no hiding anything from her. She'd already heard about breast cancer before, so I guess I'm lucky that she's old enough to understand a bit more, in some ways. Thanks for your insight! :)
Posts.Title: Husband doesn't want to tell our 5 year old ChristaSea

Posts.Content: May 12, 2015 08:46PM Allyme wrote: Thanks for responding, Iamstronger. I don't have big leakage, and it only usually happens when I am up moving around. It Only started when I tried Metamucil, even though I was having perfectly fine bowel movements. I was afraid with the pain meds, I would have those problems. Instead, I created a different problem. Anyway, thanks bunches for your response! :)
Posts.Title: anyone have problems with fecal incontinence? Allyme tinyturtle

Posts.Content: Allyme wrote: I know I'm still new to this dx. I know there is no cure. I know all the things I will miss. I love nature, hearing the birds and watching the deer in my back yard. I always loved helping others, which is why I became a nurse and a medic in the Army. From a small child, I was told God is watching over me. I always believed and trusted, and still do. I have overcome so many difficult situations, thanks to God watching and protecting me. I just can't help but wonder: why not this time? Why do I have to have an incurable disease? Why can't I grow old with those I love? I wonder if God is still watching over me? Every time I think of my dx, I can't help but wonder why God wants this for me. I've always lived my life for God and actually felt as if I've always been watched over. Now, I'm just totally confused. I'm thankful for each day, but I want many many more. Why can't I have those? I'm sorry I can't just take one day at a time, and be happy with it. I really thought that if I lived my life , doing what I was supposed to, I would be blessed with a long, happy life with those I love. I still believe, I just don't understand. Thanks for reading my rant, but I don’t think there's any thing that can be said to make sense of why I can't stay with my hubby and daughter, who I love so dear. Targeted Therapy 9/27/2014 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Targeted Therapy 9/27/2014 Perjeta (pertuzumab) Dx 9/28/2014, Stage IV, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Chemotherapy 9/30/2014 Taxol (paclitaxel) Radiation Therapy 10/31/2014 Bone Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: A rant about life Allyme Allyme

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2015 06:23PM Allyme wrote: Music lover, All the docs I've seen so far tell me this is terminal. They laugh as soon as I talk about being HER2 +, like that is information I'm not supposed to know about, only they are "allowed" to know. They treat me like I'm just supposed to shut - up and take whatever TX they give me, because I'm terminal. It doesn't matter, right? That's why I'm finally fed up, & will be hearing from the new onc tomorrow. If not, I guess I'll be starting that thread you suggested! Thanks for your insight! I really appreciate you! :)
Posts.Title: A rant about life Allyme Allyme

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2015 07:35PM Allyme wrote: Music Lover, I'm so glad I'm not alone! I keep reading where everyone seems to be generally well accepting of their dx. I just can't get there. I don't think I ever will. I'm just not ready for this life to be over. Thanks so much for understanding!! :)
Posts.Title: A rant about life Allyme Allyme

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2015 08:26PM Allyme wrote: kandy, Thanks for responding , and for letting me know I'm not alone. I honestly have no idea how much time would have to pass before i gain a similar outlook. I do know it varies for everyone, I'm just worried that I may never accept it. I really don't know how I could live, not being able to accept it someday. Right now, I think I'm just too outraged o even consider acceptance. But, I am glad for those who have reached that level. Thanks so much for your thoughts! :)
Posts.Title: A rant about life Allyme Allyme

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2015 09:13PM Allyme wrote: KJones13, Thanks for sharing your story! That was quite an experience! I find comfort in people who can relate to what I'm going through, which isn't many these days. I'm also thankful for people like you, who I feel I can relate to in a religious way. I love God and the blessings i have. I too would like to know that answer someday. I just wish I had the answer now! Thanks for your insight! :)
Posts.Title: A rant about life Allyme Allyme

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2015 08:38PM Allyme wrote: exbrnxgrl, Thanks for responding! I think that's what bugs me the most. I can't understand why bad things happen to good people. I can't understand how you can live your life eating healthy, exercising, living by God's and man's rules, and these things happen to us. It makes me wonder some times, why all the hard work, if this is my end result. I hope time really does help, because right now, not so much. Thanks for your insight, and I really do appreciate you! :)
Posts.Title: A rant about life Allyme Allyme

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2015 08:06AM Allyme wrote: Penny, You are right. I have noticed some positive things come out of this negative. Before this, I hardly had a relationship with my in-laws. Now they are involved in my life more. Me and my husband weren't very close, but now it seems like we couldn't get any closer. Before I never really thought about what my family means to me. Now they're all I think about day and night! I love them more than anything! I am truly thankful for these positives in my life. Thanks for helping me to see that everything hasn't been negative since this dx. I appreciate you! :)
Posts.Title: A rant about life Allyme Allyme

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2015 09:23PM Allyme wrote: Chris, Thanks so very much for your understanding! That's basically what my days consist of, especially the crying. Of course I know it won't help, and I know it changes nothing. It's just like a release - valve to me, and your right, I can feel better at least until the next time. Thanks so much for letting me know this is okay! :)
Posts.Title: A rant about life Allyme Allyme

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2015 08:17AM Allyme wrote: Little sun, Thanks for helping me to realize that not all hope is lost. I love hearing success stories, and wondering if I could have a success story to tell others someday. It's hard to feel like that everyday, but I try to stay hopeful, although I don't think I'll ever understand why this happened in the first place. Thanks for your positive thoughts! :)
Posts.Title: A rant about life Allyme Allyme

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2015 06:33PM Allyme wrote: Kayrnic, I agree that God chooses to be with us in good and bad . I know God loves us, and wouldn't leave us hanging without any help. Finding the help has been my problem. Hopefully, God will send me someone who is truly willing and wanting to help me. Thanks for your kind words! :)
Posts.Title: A rant about life Allyme Allyme

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2015 03:15AM - edited Mar 27, 2015 03:23AM by Allyme To all of you, Thanks so very much! You all have lifted me up in your own ways! I feel love, confidence, strength, and feel like I have each of you right here beside me! I appreciate the different Bible verses, as I feel God wanted me to remember those specifically! God does work in mysterious ways, and I do believe I was supposed to hear from all of you. God knows I need serious back-up, as I've been feeling quite alone lately, and defeated most days. I am so happy for all I have in my life, you all included! I really don't know what I would've done without you all helping guide me through this, and keeping my spirit up! I thank you all so much for your words of encouragement, info, and kindness! Thanks for being here with me to fight this fight, as so many others have left me! I appreciate you all!! :)
Posts.Title: A rant about life Allyme Allyme

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2015 06:28PM Allyme wrote: Little sun, First, thanks for responding, as I really wasn't sure anybody would. I appreciate that. Next, I love those two quotes, and how they tie in. It helps me realize that this wasn't a form of punishment. Bad things can happen to good people, but some positive can still come out of the negative. Thanks for posting, it makes me feel somewhat better, or at least not as bad as I was feeling before! Thanks so much for your thoughts! :)
Posts.Title: A rant about life Allyme Allyme

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2015 07:46AM Allyme wrote: Divine, That, you are so true of. My belief system did take a whopping of a hit, just like me. And you're right, I've got to find some way to make sense of it all. Because I still believe. I just have no idea why I was one of the chosen to have a terminal illness, rather than to win the lottery. Thanks for your words of inspiration! :)
Posts.Title: A rant about life Allyme Allyme

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2015 05:11PM Allyme wrote: Deanna, You are so correct. Today, I went to see a specialist who was provided to me by the onc I've been seeing. This "specialist" kept on going on about his friendship with the onc, and nothing about my situation. I totally wondered why I was sitting there half-naked when he never even checked my breasts. All he did was say that they're great friends and he's doing the right thing. That's when I realized I wasn't going to get real TX if I stayed where I was at. I asked the specialist to refer me to someone else in upmc, since my onc is not. He was upset about how I would make him look to the onc!! I told him that I can't get TX from someone I can't talk to, or trust that they have my best outcome in mind. I felt so relieved when he finally agreed, and it was an onc I had seen years ago, before my dx. I felt comfort and relief at hearing his name, so hopefully this is another positive in the negatives! Thanks so much for your insight! It's spot on! :)
Posts.Title: A rant about life Allyme Allyme

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2015 05:20PM Allyme wrote: Beachbum, Thanks so much for your thoughts! I try to stay far away from those dark places also. They don't do any good for anyone. I may cry most of the time, but I find it to be more out of anger, than anything. I do agree, we have to fight. It just becomes tiring sometimes. Thanks so much for your insight! :)
